content:
Sure, here is an updated comprehensive page structure for all 24 pages:

1. Login Page:
* A login form that includes fields for entering a username and password
* A "Forgot Password" link that allows users to reset their password
* A "Sign Up" link that directs users to a registration page (if applicable)
* A "Remember Me" checkbox that allows users to stay logged in on the device
2. Dashboard:
* A summary of sales data, including total sales, sales by category, and sales by date range
* A summary of inventory levels, including total quantity, quantity by category, and low stock alerts
* A summary of customer information, including total number of customers, new customers by date range, and customer demographics
* A set of quick links to key areas of the system, such as sales, inventory, and customer management
3. Sales Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific products
* A list view of products, including product name, image, price, and quantity in stock
* A shopping cart that displays the products selected for purchase and the total cost
* A checkout process that includes fields for entering customer information and payment details
* A "View Sales History" button that allows users to view past sales transactions
4. Inventory Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific products
* A list view of products, including product name, image, price, and quantity in stock
* A "Add Product" button that allows users to add new products to the inventory
* A "Edit Product" button that allows users to edit existing products
* A "Delete Product" button that allows users to remove products from the inventory
5. Customer Management Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific customers
* A list view of customers, including customer name, contact information, and purchase history
* A "Add Customer" button that allows users to add new customers
* A "Edit Customer" button that allows users to edit existing customer information
* A "Delete Customer" button that allows users to remove customers from the system
6. Reporting and Analytics Page:
* A set of pre-configured reports, such as sales by date range, inventory levels, and customer demographics
* A set of customizable charts and graphs that allow users to analyze data in different ways
* A "Download Report" button that allows users to export data in a spreadsheet format
* A "Save Report" button that allows users to save a report for future reference
7. Settings Page:
* A section for adjusting tax rates and payment options
* A section for managing user access levels and permissions
* A "Save Changes" button that allows users to save any changes made to the settings
* A "Reset to Default" button that allows users
